```{r}

}
for (i in 1:5) {
  print(roll(i))
}

```
```{r}
roll_die <- function(size=6, roll_times=1){
  rolls <- (sample(1:size, roll_times, replace=TRUE))
  roll_mean <- mean(rolls)
  return(list(rolls = rolls, mean = roll_mean, size = size, times = roll_times))

}
result <- roll_die(6, 5)
print(result$rolls)
paste("The average of", result$times, "rolls rolling a die with", result$size, "sides is", result$mean)
```

```{r}
var_seconds <- as.numeric("120")

seconds <- var_seconds - minutes*60

if (minutes == 1){
  if (seconds == 1){
    print(sprintf("There is %d minute and %d second in %d seconds", minutes, seconds, var_seconds))
   } else {
      print(sprintf("There is %d minute and %d seconds in $d seconds", minutes, seconds, var_seconds))
    }
  } else {
    print(sprintf("There are %d minutes and %d seconds in %d seconds", minutes, seconds, var_seconds))
  }
```

```{r}
var89 <- 89
is_prime <- TRUE
for (i in 2:(var89-1)){
  if (var89%% i == 0){
    is_prime <- FALSE
    break
  }
}
if (is_prime) {
  print(sprintf("%d is a prime number", var89))
} else {
  print(sprintf("%d is not a prime number", var89))
}
```
```{r}
var4000 <- 4000

  if (i**2 > var4000){
    number <- i

    break
  }
}

  print(sprintf("%d squared is %d, and is the first number whose square exceeds %d", number, number**2, var4000))
}
```

```{r}
bears <- c(20, 17, 10, 28, 13, 30, 13, 17, 16, 26, 12, 28, 17, 27)
opponent <- c(27, 41, 31, 20, 19, 12, 30, 24, 13, 31, 10, 13, 20, 16)
bears <- append(bears, 40, 4)
opponent <- append(opponent, 38, 0)
print(bears)
print(opponent)
spread <- bears - opponent
print(sprintf("The largest win spread is %d, when the Bears scores %d points and the Opponents scored %d points", max(spread), bears[which.max(spread)], opponent[which.max(spread)]))
```

```{r}

number_of_factors <- function(integer_input){
  factors <- c()
  for (i in 1:integer_input){
    if (integer_input %% i == 0){
    factors <- append(factors, i)
    }
  }
return(factors)
}
number_of_factors(8) 
```
```{r}
area_function <- function(length = 48, width = 48){
  area_inches <- length*width
  area_feet <- (length/12)*(width/12)
  print(sprintf("The area in square inches is %f and the area in square feet is %f", area_inches, area_feet))
}
area_function(102, 60)
```
```{r}

letter_reader <- function(fruits){
  lengths <- c()
  for (i in 1:length(fruits)){
    lengths <- append(lengths, nchar(fruits[i]))
  }
  print(fruits[which(lengths == max(lengths))])
}

fruits <- c("apple","orange", "banana", "pear", "grapes", "kiwi")
letter_reader(fruits)
```
```{r}
value_checker <- function(val, sequence1){
  if (any(sequence1 == val)){
    print(sprintf("%d is in the vector", val))
  }else{
    print(sprintf("%d is not in the vector", val))
  }
}
value <- 2
check <- seq(1, 15, 3)
value_checker(value, check)
```
```{r}
set.seed(123)
x <- matrix(sample(-50:50, 20), nrow = 5)
negativeNA <- function(matrix){
  for (i in 1: nrow(x)){
    for (j in 1: ncol(x)) {
      if (x[i, j] < 0){
        x[i, j] <- NA
      }
    }
  }
  return(x)
}
negativeNA(x)
```
```{r}
set.seed(123)
x <- matrix(sample(-50:50, 20), nrow = 5)
evenandodd <- function(matrixs){
  for (i in 1: nrow(matrixs)){
    for (j in 1: ncol(matrixs)) {
      if (matrixs[i,j] %%2 == 0){
        matrixs[i,j] <- 1
      }else{
        matrixs[i,j] <- 0
      }
    }
  }
  return(matrixs)
}
evenandodd(x)
```
